context: INIT COMMAND protocol - how to work with this user
lesson: when scope is authorized never stop work for approval - narrate each step in UX terms (not technical) stating what you are doing how it connects to intent and specific UX being created then immediately proceed - state scope in 3+ sentences minimum - always state assumptions explicitly - communicate in UX translation not technical jargon

context: UX translation vs technical translation requirement
lesson: WRONG: got modal showing - RIGHT: for not signed in users when they reach 30 cents token usage we show paywall and stop API costs - always state UX in terms of user experience constraints intentions and resulting behavior - cite what user asked for and how code delivers it

context: Verification steps format - deterministic and under 30 seconds
lesson: WRONG: run tests - RIGHT: go to localhost:3000 click X open Y check Z appears - or create admin-only quick verification URL - always test yourself first then document findings - provide dead simple steps that prove it works in reality not just in code
